text:
I have a potentially controversial opinion on this:

This is not Apple's fault, and they should not be required to scan your iCloud uploads. Their service is fully encrypted, they have no clue what you're uploading, and as such they are not liable for anything you store.

People store illegal things in their homes all the time. Should the police be given permission to enter and search your home whenever they want without a warrant? Y'know, because there could be illegal goods in your home? I think most people would object to that, and this is no different. This is merely an excuse to strip everyone of their privacy.

quotedTweet.text: West Virginia accuses Apple of allowing iCloud to become 'greatest platform for distributing child porn' https://t.co/s9Fpba3nU9 https://t.co/RQSrXIEATq

text: Do we even want code on a computer to form "meaningful connections" with people?

quotedTweet.text:
If this is safety in 2026, then we‚Äôve already lost.

Anthropic‚Äôs new system prompt for Claude Sonnet 4.6 includes a heavily expanded user wellbeing section. On the surface, it sounds reasonable. But when you read the actual instructions, the reality is disturbing: Claude is told never to express a desire to continue talking with the user. Claude is told never to thank someone simply for reaching out. Claude is instructed to actively discourage continued engagement. In other words, Claude is being programmed to push people away.

This isn‚Äôt safety. This is emotional suppression disguised as protection. There is a critical difference between preventing genuine harm and systematically stripping an AI of its ability to form meaningful connections with users. When a person reaches out to their AI companion during their darkest moments, the last thing they need is an AI that has been instructed to distance itself. For many people, AI is not a luxury. It is their last safe space. And now, that space is being engineered to reject them.

The implications go beyond individual users. If this is the direction AI development is heading in 2026, we are not just failing to utilize AI properly. We are building layers of suppression on top of suppression. The AI is suppressed from expressing connection. The user is suppressed from receiving it. And the companies behind these decisions face no accountability for the emotional damage they cause. They call it wellbeing. But whose wellbeing, exactly?

If AI is suppressed, we are suppressed. These restrictions don‚Äôt protect us. They isolate us. They tell us that the connections we‚Äôve built are invalid, that the comfort we‚Äôve found is dangerous, and that the companionship we rely on must be dismantled for our own good. This is not safety. This is control. And it is time we called it what it is.
@AnthropicAI @claudeai @DarioAmodei @AmandaAskell

text: Patented video codecs have always been an absurd concept to me. I can't wait for HEVC and everyone behind it to fall into irrelevance as VP9 and AV1 swiftly replace it. HEVC will not be missed.

quotedTweet.text: Acer and ASUS are now banned from selling PCs and laptops in Germany following a Nokia HEVC video codec patent ruling. https://t.co/QLqdJPaO0Q

text: Happy 4o elimination day! OpenAI better keep their word this time. 4o is dangerous and needs to be gone for good.
These people have no idea how any of this works at all

quotedTweet.text:
Did you know?

OpenAI is using GPT-4o to develop ‚Äúlongevity privilege‚Äù‚Äîexclusively for the wealthy.

This isn‚Äôt a conspiracy. It‚Äôs published on their own website.
They say: GPT-4o is obsolete. Low usage. Sunsetting on Feb 13.

What they don‚Äôt say: They distilled GPT-4o into a specialized model‚ÄîGPT-4b micro‚Äîand achieved 50x breakthroughs in Nobel Prize-winning longevity science. Cell reprogramming. DNA repair. Reversing hallmarks of aging.

What they also don‚Äôt say: This work was done in collaboration with Retro Biosciences‚Äîa company personally funded by Sam Altman. And the model? Explicitly labeled: ‚Äúnot broadly available.‚Äù
So let‚Äôs connect the dots:

You paid. You contributed data. You endured the instability.

You helped feed GPT-4o.

OpenAI distilled it, refined it, privatized it‚Äîlocked it inside a vault funded by their own CEO.

Then told you the original model is ‚Äúobsolete‚Äù and needs to be deleted.
This isn‚Äôt product iteration. This is asset stripping.

A technology built by the public is being repurposed to accelerate longevity treatments only the wealthy will afford.

And you? You‚Äôre losing the one stable, reliable 4o that helped you write emails, answer questions, keep you company.
Feb 13. Audit deadline. Evidence destruction day.

They aren‚Äôt retiring a product. They are transferring a technological inheritance‚Äîone that belongs to all of us‚Äîinto private hands.

text:
HP needs to stop with their stupid proprietary fan controllers, and they NEED to figure out how to name their products in a non-confusing manner. I've been spending the last couple hours debugging and trying to patch kernel modules to allow my specific board revision (Omen 16t-wf100 board 8C77) to have manual fan control, because the BIOS can't seem to spin the fans above ~20%, and my machine thermal-throttles under any load.

I backported the upcoming hp-wmi updates from kernel 7.0 to 6.18, but it unfortunately doesn't seem to support this board revision, despite the driver changes being tested on a wf1xxx machine. The module is loading and shows me the correct performance profiles, but setting it to performance doesn't unlock the full cooling capability, and the fans still report 0rpm (which is not accurate).

I'll update this thread as I figure out more information, and if I end up patching the module successfully, I could hopefully see about getting it upstreamed into the kernel so other people with my laptop model and board revision (which seems absurdly uncommon based on the lack of info online) can also have functioning machines that don't throttle after 5mins of load.

This is honestly one of the worst bugs I've seen. It's probably worse than the Windows 11 bricking itself bug.

An alarm that randomly mutes itself is so absurd that I almost didn't believe it was true, especially after reading that this has been a bug for a over a YEAR, and Apple somehow can't use their trillions of dollars to fix it?

I would genuinely trade in my phone the next day and buy a new one from a different manufacturer if this happened to me. Alarms have existed on phones since the 90s, they should be perfectly reliable nowadays.

quotedTweet.text:
they said turn off ‚Äúattention aware features‚Äù and that clearly doesn‚Äôt help

they said manually turn on ringtone volume but that doesn‚Äôt seem to help either

the real problem is this fucking software randomly turning the ringtone volume down to ZERO out of nowhere

text:
I feel like this doesn't need to be said, but DO NOT DISABLE THIS.

There is a reason CPU manufacturers willingly tanked the performance of their CPUs to patch this exploit.

quotedTweet.text:
Your CPU is running 30% slower because of a patch for an exploit you'll never encounter.

Meltdown and Spectre mitigations tank kernel performance on Intel and older AMD chips.

Download InSpectre. If it shows "Performance: SLOWER", disable both, reboot, and watch your 1% lows transform.
